website_summaries.verdict: Constructed from steel, this can crusher is easy to mount on your wall or counter - especially if you use screws that are more heavy-duty than those supplied.
pros: Attaches to both vertical surfaces like walls and horizontal surfaces like tables
Choice of device to crush 12 or 16 ounce cans
cons: The screws that come with this crusher could be higher quality
Consider using better ones to install it

customer_reviews.title: COMPANY TRYING TO MAKE THINGS RIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap. I had a bag full of cans I wanted to crush. Got about 29 through, the handle came apart and the linkage bent. WTH! I think this thing was made from recycled aluminum cans. Very disappointed. THE COMPANY REACHED OUT TO ME IN REGARDS TO MY REVIEW AND SEEMED TO BE CONCERNED ABOUT MY NEGATIVE EXPERIENCE. THEY STATED THAT THEY WERE AWARE OF THE HANDLE DEFECT AND HAVE CORRECTED IT. THEY ALSO OFFERED TO REFUND THE PURCHASE PRICE. WHILE I DO NOT KNOW WHAT IMPROVEMENTS HAVE BEEN MADE, I DO APPRECIATE THEM TRYING TO MAKE THINGS RIGHT.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Really cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy! Warning. We have had this can crusher for about a month. Within the first week the handle fell apart. We used a zip tie to hold it together. It seemed to work. After another week or two the bottom fell off. The welding and screw fell off or both the handle and bottom. We have only used it properly with coke cans. About 5-6 cans a day. I also had noticed that we had to slightly squeeze the can before putting it into crush first. It seems to not be a good piece of equipment. It literally has one job. Although, it stayed on the wall, now we have holes in our wall. :(
customer_reviews.author: JL Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Broke 2 days after mounting
customer_reviews.text: It felt heavy-duty when I opened the box. My husband mounted it on our patio. It was mounted on the 12x12 base of the covered patio on the inner side. On the second day of normal use (my husband and I having a few beers on the back porch) the 2 side brackets that lead to the handle bent and the pin that holds the rubber handle on came loose. I've rigged it up with a pin I had in the shed and bent the brackets back in place but I would not buy this again. I would not recommend this purchase to anyone unless you enjoy throwing money away.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Edited review to reflect follow up
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. The 12 oz cans are almost the same diameter as the hole in the center of the crushing pad which makes centering the can a pain. Should’ve made the hole just a little smaller and the cans would crush flat every time instead of kicking sideways and getting stuck in the hole. After being contacted by the seller-unsolicited, by the way- they have shipped out a new crusher with a different design. No hole in the crushing plate makes for a WHOLE lot smoother operation. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
customer_reviews.author: Klint Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a winner!
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to other reviews, my machine accepts 12oz soda cans without doing a partial crush. I also have had good luck with crushing without partially hand crushing. The pull tab opening straight out made a near perfect crush. Only a few days of experience but seems like a winner. Vaseline on the on the side rail guides and spray grease on the joints and it works very smoothly. I think reasonable intended use and it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: shed469

customer_reviews.title: This is really a flimsy piece of crap. I have to be very careful crushing the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really a flimsy piece of crap. I have to be very careful crushing the can, because the sides of the crusher want to get "caught" and get bent out of shape. Actually, in order to even crush a can, I have to pre-crush it a bit. I have had can crushers before, and this one is awful. The others I've had were actually sturdy and worked great! I would never buy this again nor recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ShadyLadyShadow

customer_reviews.title: It works great for crushing cans
customer_reviews.text: It works great for crushing cans. Unfortunately, mine will not stay in the up position. So every time I crush a can, the handle falls to the bottom and I have to lift it again to crush another can. 1st world problems I guess... EDIT: After speaking with customer support, I received a new one that works better and stays up. I upgraded to 4/5 stars because the cushion on the handle wears down pretty quickly but it doesn't affect the functionality of the can crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Will Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because it had good reviews. The product I looked at was a light silver and the product I received was a dark silver. I installed it as soon as I received it and it seems to be a little flimsy. Not what I had anticipated. If I had known I would not have ordered.
customer_reviews.author: TomT

customer_reviews.title: Mk-II excellent
customer_reviews.text: The cans are crushed. The unit performs a bit jerkily, and a touch of WD-40 helps. We'll see how long it lasts. Update: have run about 150 can through it, still works well. 2020: Replacement of original (bought almost exactly 3 years ago) is sturdier, and the Mk-II crushes a bit more (original was maybe 30% of full height; Mk-II is about 20%). Handle pad is better designed. A bit of spray lube (always lube first!!!!!!!!!!!) smooths the action.
customer_reviews.author: DogFace

customer_reviews.title: Cans and some gentle support when being crushed
customer_reviews.text: This items work great, most of the time. I've had quite a few cans pop out of the crusher as they've slipped when being compressed. When attempting to reinsert the can, about 1/3 of the time, it won't fit back in as the top and bottom become severely misaligned . To avoid this, you have to GENTLY hold the can in place with one finger (or perhaps use a short wood dowel) to keep the can between the crush plate and the crusher base. DO NOT use firm pressure when using your finger to keep the can in place as it is possible for the side of the can to burst, thus exposing sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Handle fell apart at 1 month and 10 days...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed... It was well built, at first. Seemed perfect for what I needed it to do, crush some cans. However, about a week ago my daughter told me that the handle failed while the wife and I were out. I got it back together for a couple days, but it failed again. I can try to remove it from the wall, peen it some to mushroom it out some more, but, why? Why should I have to? They were already wrapping this in a movable foam grip, why not just tack weld it on the outside? It would be more permanently affixed and the foam would still rotate around the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M

customer_reviews.title: Bent after one week of use
customer_reviews.text: Update: After a week of use, this it’s already completely bent on both arms. Very disappointing. See photos. Not recommended. Easy to use and seems sturdy! Handle is comfortable. My only complaint is that I don't feel this crushes the cans flat enough; the top crushing platform stops too soon, so you're left with about a 0.75" height which takes up more room in my can. Overall though, I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a can crusher. Props to the manufacturer as well for communication; apparently they had some instances where customer's were sent the wrong color, so they sent a message to ensure I received what I ordered. 4/5 Stars and would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy of Oz

customer_reviews.title: It does its job well..
customer_reviews.text: Install on a stud or you will pull your house down.. It crushes cans and plastic water bottles which allows me to have a more compact recycling space.. My curbside only lets me use a small container they provide, this allows me to effectively use the container without left over water bottles flooding my kitchen.. protip, loosen the cap of the water bottle before you crush it, tighten the cap after and it won't try to spring back to it's regular size..
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Great can-crushing device. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-built can crushing device. I haven't yet bolted it to the wall because I really enjoy using it as a "hand tool" and find it quite satisfying to crush cans on a daily basis. We purchased this because we started drinking fizzy water in cans and our recycling/trash was getting very bulky and out of control. The can crushing device has restored order to our home. Our recycling that used to take over many bags now fits into a small container. I would recommend this device to anyone who needs to crush cans. It works great and is well built, sturdy, and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Lover of Life, Sunsets, Cats and Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great... But handle pin failure
customer_reviews.text: Over all this is a great can crusher. It has a little side to side sway. Otherwise super functional Problem: the pressed in handle pin bent and blew out in the forst two days.. ...maybe I drink too much beer? Though I would assume the target audience would male the same (if not more) use of the apparatus. I pit in a 4" x 1/4 inch bolt... Two washers.. And used thread locker on the nut. I didnt have a locknut around and believe it wpuld have the same results. Works great now!. I would order it again and be prepared to replace the pin.
customer_reviews.author: (\/)ilo

customer_reviews.title: Jammed up after a few weeks of normal use.
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly excited to get this in my office. I used one in my last office (different brand) and it helped keep the warehouse clear of soda drip when the guys stomped on the cans. I installed it to the warehouse wall and within a few weeks the handle got jammed. Now it only goes down easily, then you have to force it up. Looks like the back of the top lever is not playing well with the paint. Sorely dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Dude, full send
customer_reviews.text: Very effective at condensing recycling: I purchased the 12oz can crusher and it’s well worth it if you drink a lot of beer or soda... or like me, live in a frat house, we can now fill up an entire recycling bin full of crushed cans instead of our resident Nibs creating litter! Installation is recommended somewhere with a flat stud, a few pilot holes, and about 2ft of outward space (so you can actually operate it without getting into a weird position) again, I’m in my early 20’s and I took it with me when I graduated- that’s my opinion, it’s so great
customer_reviews.author: Seth Caswell

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Problems with space meant I had to replace my ancient can crusher. This new one seemed to be just what I needed. That is what it proved to be. It was easy to mount on the wall and it did the job with a lot less effort than I had been spending trying to crush can with my previous unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Fehring

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Step on your cans instead.
customer_reviews.text: So I thought it would be a great idea to get one of these to crush the cans in a possibly safer manner. I was wrong. This product is incredibly weak. At first I thought it was stout, but it's only crushed about 30 cans and the arm that you pull down is already bent to the point where it's useless. I'm sure I'm not the only one with this issue. I wish I could return it, but it's passed the 30 days. Do not waste your money on this. It isn't a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product.
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this product a lot. I've crushed hundreds of can (perhaps thousand since I got it) and have saved much space because of how well it crushes. It's very simple design, but the leverage allows for minimal effort to crash most cans. The only reason I didn't give this a five star is because the handle is poorly designed (or assembled) as it comes apart from the arm easily. I had to duck tape the bars to make sure the handle stayed in tact.
customer_reviews.author: Terry K. Baines

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: This product does not hold up. After 1 month, rivet in handle popped, and the base of the device broke loose, so that cans just slide off instead of crushing. Wish I would have done a better job at researching this product/company. "McKay" does not have a website, or any contact info, So I cannot appeal to them to replace the faulty device.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: 9/10 works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Great product worked perfect. I only have two issues with it but they don't effect it's functionality at all. The first one is that foam handle. As it rolls it gives a crunchy grinding sound and feels weird in your hand. The other issue is the somewhat clunky feeling as you crush the can. Simple solution to that would be lithium grease along the sides where the plumber is. Including a small packet with each purchase would be a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Crushes, but plan install location ahead!
customer_reviews.text: The hardest part with this thing is where do you install it? It’s not exactly a “kitchen beauty”. And who wants to go out to the garage to crush every can? Luckily, I found a hidden spot in my kitchen where it serves a really great purpose. We don’t have a big house and we have to carry our own recycling. This makes those trips much less frequent! One note, I have only crushed about 150 cans so far. It seems to be holding up well but hope it does for the long run also.
customer_reviews.author: drsharon

customer_reviews.title: I start to do a little something for this planet
customer_reviews.text: Like everything treated nice little treat good to you I was surprised wasn't paying attention but it also crushes plastic bottles which is a nightmare in the ocean right now and if we don't start paying attention to this I don't know if you're a fisherman or you eat fish and you care about turtles and every animal in the ocean we're killing this planet this is one step paint attention to slow down in the nightmare highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nicky De Risi

customer_reviews.title: 3-in-1 device: Impressive features & quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this can crusher in the blue color & LOVE it!!! It’ a can crusher, bottle crusher & bottle opener all in one. The body is made of sturdy metal that seems like it will last a while. I installed this on a stud to make sure the force generated during use did not tear it off the wall. My only grip is that there were no drywall anchors included in the hardware packet (only screws were included) which is one reason why I installed it on a stud.
customer_reviews.author: BayouTi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy can crusher but with a squeaky handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made sturdy can crusher that does a good job crushing soda cans down to about an inch of height. We have it securely screwed into wall studs in our pantry and it seems to be holding up. A few things though. 1) There is no "Auto Dispensing" - the cans don't eject themselves. This is ok actually as I don't really want that. 2) The rubber pad at the bottom wears quickly. We're about 20 cans crushed and it is already worn through. 3) The handle is really squeaky! The foam rubs against the metal and makes a pretty annoying noise. May be better just to cut the foam away.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Rake

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but not as sturdy as it could be.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January 2019. It does feel somewhat flimsy, but I haven't had any of the problems I've read in other reviews. I've run hundreds of cans through it and the powder coating is in tact, the handle is fine; overall it's a little wobbly (hence only 2 stars for the sturdiness rating) but it's held up fine. As an aside, the instructions clearly state that you need to put a small dent in the cans before you crush them. To do this, I just put a can in it and poke it with my finger to make a small dent and then crush the can.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Did not last the warranty period; poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: This crusher worked very well for several months, before the bottom plate broke and angled downward, making it impossible to hold a can upright and crush it. Customer service was generally apathetic, taking two days to send a canned response each time I inquired about having this replaced under warranty. They finally did ask for my shipping address, but no replacement was ever sent and they became unavailable by email. Would not buy this product, or anything else, from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Green

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT FOR ME!
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher does what I bought it to do...it crushes cans!!! It has 3 screws at the top and 1 at the bottom for mounting. Only 1 of the top 3 found a stud, the rest are just in the drywall. This is my first product of this type. Effortless to use, and locks firmly in the up position, out of the way, the rest of the time. So far, I've only crushed 12 oz cans, but it's built to take 16's. It looks and feels well built. If anything changes, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Frisco TX

customer_reviews.title: Jusy buy it. It crushes cans very well.
customer_reviews.text: Just but it. This thing seems to do they job just fine. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 stars is that the lever and handle seem a bit flimsy. So I have minor concers of the long term longevity. If it last a year it's earned its keep.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schwacofer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about a month. Now, at less than 3 months old, the handle has bent completely out of shape, nearly folding in half on the last can I crunched. I'm a petite woman that works a desk job so it's not like my Brut strength ruined it, either. I'll be looking for something else that is up to the task at hand. I crush about 16 sparkling water cans a week.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher does crush, but only if you're spot on with placement of the can. If even a 1/4 inch from against the back, it will shoot out at you, partially crushed. The angle of the bottom plate is off, creating this problem. Will be getting a different one. The lever falls back down after each cycle too, causing me to raise the bail to do another can. Wasted effort.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Thier

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the Task
customer_reviews.text: Securely bolted this to a 4x4 garage stud. Worked great for a couple months and then the rivet on the right side of the handle broke, fixed this and then a couple months later, yesterday, the arm assembly broke. This item, or at least the one I received is poorly constructed and not up to it's single useful task of crushing cans. I am halfway through the 2nd kitchen trash bag of crushed cans.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Great for aluminum cans
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this on one of the cabinets and tried it out. Works great but make sure you install all of the screws. Trust me on that one. It flattens all of my soda cans but didn't work for more heavy duty cans like soup cans. Pros: heavy duty. Well made. Comes with hardware. Now I can put a lot more stuff in my recycle bin. Cons: doesn't work on heavier cans
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome can crusher!
customer_reviews.text: I had one can crusher for about 15 years with no problems. It finally broke this past winter and i have tried several other brands since it broke and each one broke on me. This McKay can crusher is so solid and sturdy. It even has a little grip on the bottom so you can crush a can one handed. Plus the ability to crush 16oz cans is much appreciated. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: NOT ALL 12 OZ. CANS ARE THE SAME SIZE THEREFORE THEY DON'T ALL FIT INTO A 12 OZ. CAN CRUSHER.
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says it will do. It crushes 12 oz. aluminum cans quite well. There is one thing that I did not think about when I ordered it. All 120z. cans are not the same height. For instance, 12 oz. Coors Light cans are taller than 12 oz. Bud Light cans. Michelobe Ultra cans are even taller than either of the other two. In that I drink Coors Light and my wife drinks Ultra, I should have ordered a 16 oz. can crusher. I had already screwed it to a post on our deck when I realized it. Other than that, the product works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wade Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Weak Points
customer_reviews.text: The general design is okay for the user but is not built for the long run. I love the plastic bottle neck hole but this may have contributed the the deformation of the mechanism only after a couple of weeks use. I had to hammer the unit back in shape to stop if from binding on itself. I did not crush anything other than aluminum or plastic.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Baich

customer_reviews.title: Buy this can crusher!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the color Red and so far this can crusher is holding up pretty good! The last can crusher I purchased from another manufacturer lasted about a month when the handle came off and the brads started to pull out and the bottom lip weld broke!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven McKim

customer_reviews.title: It was beat up
customer_reviews.text: *****UPDATE***** After about a month of use it broke. The handle has come apart and and bar is warped. This was a huge waste of money, super disappointed in this product! The pictures are showing it broke, the dents were already there when I opened the package. When we opened the box, the can crusher was dented and paint was all chipped. After about 2 days of use, the handle has kind of warped, which makes it a little difficult to pull down.
customer_reviews.author: Raychele

customer_reviews.title: Works good for the money
customer_reviews.text: With being stuck at home, I am faced with drinking more beer. As a result, my recycling become full, very quickly. A quick search on Amazon landing me this beauty. Seems like a very nice can crusher and the cosmetic aspects of it look great. It does feel a tad bit flimsier than would be ideal, but for the price, you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hood

customer_reviews.title: base is not weled
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product a second time. Huge problem! The base is connected to the pivot of the arm and base. So if there is to much pressure it bends the base, shooting the can out at an angel not strait down. Stupid design. Why? My eight year old niece could be a better design engineer for this company. It would only take 2 additional weld points with the base not being apart of the pivot points. I'm seriously talking with chines manufactures to be there competition. If they are, "Amazon's choice" for this product the market has to be open to someone smarter.
customer_reviews.author: Ebourlffer

customer_reviews.title: Under-engineered, cheap piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: By the time I crushed the third aluminum can, the can base was bent. By the twentieth can, the black metal straps that pull the top down were bent and the handle was skewed off to one side and I had to bend it back. You have to pre-dent the cans and many of the cans shoot out at you half crushed. In addition, it doesn't fully crush the cans. The can is crushed to about 1-1/2" tall. For some reason, most of the cans tear, creating very sharp edges that you don't get when you crush the can with your foot. Extremely disappointed with this design. Tossing it in the trash and going back to stomping.
customer_reviews.author: Denise S.

customer_reviews.title: Well build and does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This is a can crusher and it does what it is supposed to do. I will say that construction appears excellent so I have no concerns about long term reliability. I purchased the 16 oz. crusher for flexibility but most of my usage is with 12 oz. cans and you should be aware that due to the increased height your 12 oz cans will not get crushed quite as flat as they might with the smaller model. I don't consider this an issue and would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Pinyon

customer_reviews.title: Short Lifetime -- 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in December and it is now June (same year) and the product has become defunct. The plate at the bottom has become lose and bends down, not allowing for a crush of cans without ejection. I would recommend getting another brand and would do so myself for a future purchase. The Crusher seems like a good alternative and my in-laws have one that has been around for years, if only I spent $5 more I would be in a better place. Bottom line, don't pinch pennies get a better quality one and have no headache in 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Crooked.
customer_reviews.text: The bottom shelf was bent in such a way that a standard coke can would not fit in. The handle swept down at a crooked angle. The screws on the side of the handle scraped against the sides of the device, messing up the paint after 3 uses. I am returning. Hopefully mine was a QA anomaly.
customer_reviews.author: Charley Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Welove it. We figured though with the amount of force needed to crush a can that if we did not really securely mount it in a stud we would end up regretting it. So my hubby built it a mounting most instead and its fabulous. We have not tried any plastic bottles yet, but I am assuming its just as effective. This will cut down a huge amount on recycling can space.
customer_reviews.author: hikinghoney

customer_reviews.title: Black metal could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: The handle and the black sides. After some use you can imagine it gets a little sticky. The black part bends to easily. I wasn't standing right in Front of it and I ended up pulling down as it pulled to the side. It hasn't been the same since. It does what it supposed to just make sure you always pull it down straight.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: This can crusher works great on standard soda or beer cans
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher works great on standard soda or beer cans.If you are a beer drinker,the slender taller 12 oz. cans,such as Coors light or keystone, will not fit unless you fold,and slightly crush them first.It will crush 16 oz cans too.But this takes even more effort to get them to fit.I gave it 5 stars because it clearly says it is for 12 oz cans.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best $17 dollars ever spent
customer_reviews.text: This is like the best $ we ever spent. It's been 6 weeks since my husband's birthday and he's still crushing cans with the enthusiasm of a kid. Get one.
customer_reviews.author: beanbun

customer_reviews.title: Works great but had room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I love it. If they made an add-on to attach to a garbage can ( included or for additional purchase) would make it even more amazing. It needs to be mounted to something before you can crush a can. I want a mount to put it over a garabge can so I can crush and drop it and any fluid right into the can. Right now I have to mount to wall or build on from scratch. Otherwise, seems great!
customer_reviews.author: Dv8fox

customer_reviews.title: I would be very hard press to call this item "Heavy Duty"
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is a very light can crusher... It wobbles on the down stroke while crushing the can... The linkage is held together with rivets which can be replaced with bolts when the rivets fail but I should not have to re-work there product... I would not purchase this product again...GL
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - wife crushes cans with ease
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Easy to use - wife crushes cans with ease. Easy to mount to wall and not overly conspicuous in my garage! Will only do regular 12 oz. cans but that's all I need it for. If you want a crusher for taller cans like 16 oz., red bull, Coors or the like, the opening is too short! Seems to be sturdily built, but haven't used it for very long, so time will tell! Right now - very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Crushes It!
customer_reviews.text: No problem crushing cans. Dimpled per instructions results in easy crushing and probably easier on the crusher. I've read many reviews where the crushers did not hold up well and wonder if the users dimpled the cans prior to crushing. Also, I think many may try to apply too much force after can reaches it's crushed state causing strain on the crusher.
customer_reviews.author: TomG

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I have had this crusher for about a year now and we still use it every day. This crusher is for aluminum cans. We did not attached the crusher to the wall, we have it free sitting on a counter. Its very easy to crush the cans if you pinch the side of the can before crushing. Its worth the price and its still working after a year.
customer_reviews.author: darchard

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My teenagers use this to crush their soda cans. It’s fairly easy to install, but I recommend using a stud finder, because it will rip itself right off the wall if not mounted properly to a stud. We have had a couple cans slip out at the bottom and get crushed sideways, and almost got a finger. Overall it’s a good product and we love the red color. I would recommend just being careful. I crushes the taller cans as well, like the large size energy drink cans. It will crush soda bottles too, but we have not used it for plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie Linginfelter

customer_reviews.title: Strong and dependable
customer_reviews.text: We have had a plastic can crushers in the past. They work, but not like this McKay's heavy duty can crusher. We've only had the for month or two but we have already crushed two garbage bags full of cans. With one pull the can is crushed! Has an anti-skid pad on the bottom to keep the can in place. It comes in different colors which is nice. We got Red! I think they make bigger sizes. So, if you or your kids drink those energy drinks like Red Bull or Monster I would say get the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: Compact crusher hangs inside my pantry. We've been using it for a couple months now and it works great. Doesn't take much to smash a can and cans come out really flat. You do have to push a slight dimple in the can before you close down the smasher or the can will fly out at you. Not a problem, it's very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Spooky

customer_reviews.title: Good product, easy to install, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you can use a drill and a screwdriver, you can install this can crusher. Once installed, crushing the cans a breeze. It's well made, and it works. What else do you need to know? Quick hint: slightly dent your cans before crushing them. It makes crushing them much easier.
customer_reviews.author: WMAC8898

customer_reviews.title: A perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: This product replaces a similar can crusher that has endured 20 years is a salt-air environment. Curiously, the hole for the installation screws are identical to the one I replaced. I can only assume it was made by the same manufacturer even though I could find no manufacturer mark on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauretta B. Lingle

customer_reviews.title: Warps. Not as effective as the classics.
customer_reviews.text: It crushes standard cans and bottles well. But the product is made of aluminum and so it bends out of shape rather quickly. Some taller cans and bottles fit but not all. I have to partially crush big cans like large beers or energy drinks by hand first before using this. I’m used to the old heavy duty and much larger crushers. This isn’t that. It also does not crush them completely flat. It drastically reduces their size, but I could crush them further by standing on them.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Love a can crusher? Guilty as charged.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item on a whim and I have to say I love it! I put it on the wall in a somewhat obscure area of my kitchen, near my recycling bin and it works great. I am caffeine-free Diet Coke addict so I have more empty cans than any reasonable adult should have so this handy device makes my recycling bin appear that I am "normal", which is great! Especially for such a reasonable price! Love is a mystery but I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia J Moore

customer_reviews.title: Don't pull from the side.
customer_reviews.text: Range of motion not enough to crush the can all the way. I had to use a deck of cards as padding. But the real problem is that after about 3 months of normal usage the side pieces of the handle got bent entirely out of shape making the gadget unusable. If you only ever pull the handle while standing directly in front of the crusher, without ANY sideways tension, you'll be happy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Silvio Levy

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy - No Flex when Crushing
customer_reviews.text: One of the things I was worried about when researching a can Crusher, was getting a Crusher made with metal just barely thicker that the cans I was crushing. I've used this one for about 4 days now, and it has a solid crushing motion, with no flexing, meaning the joints (or rivets in the joints) will last for a long time. My only issue (which I discovered after I installed) is that it will not fit taller cans (Energy Drinks and such) But that is on me, I was only focusing on the soda can's that me and my wife drink, not the energy drinks my Bro in law or daughter like to drink.
customer_reviews.author: Zeerow

customer_reviews.title: Not so sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Within a few hours of use both the arms and frame were bent bad. I bent back and am still using but would recommend something better built.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and works great. You have to be careful not to hit your hand on the upper metal piece when crushing too fast. Would have given a better rating but the packing (inside and out) was in bad shape - the exterior box was badly crushed and the interior screw bag was dirty and opened resulting in a scratched unit that will probably cause some rusting -
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction. The cheap pot metal pin on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Poor construction. The cheap pot metal pin on the handle broke on the fifth can crushed (the laughable peening broke on the side. Thankfully it's a cheap fix (since it's not an overly expensive product it wasn't worth the hassle of returning it after I'd already mounted it on the wall). Drill the other side out (that still has the little burred edge holding it to the side) and replace it with a 1/4"x4 1/2" threaded bolt (I used a hex head bolt, a couple of washers, a 1/4" lock ring and a nut).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Black

customer_reviews.title: Does Not crush all 12oz cans
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money, have used it for a week or so. Does not crush Coors Lite 12oz. Feels like it need smoother connections or they need to be lubricated. Needs to be mounted on a strong surface. I used larger/ longer screws than provided. When this breaks, I will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Konters

customer_reviews.title: Well made/sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband last month. He’s gone through several can crushers in as many years (different brands) and has been frustrated by how easily they have broken. THIS can crusher is solidly made and well designed. Additionally, it was easy to put up. VERY pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Works well and handy to have around
customer_reviews.text: Works well. My only dislike: At the very end of crushing a can, it seems like area where the handle connects could be reinforced a little more. Other than that, it's great and easy to use, even for kids. (Note: squeezing the can a bit first will make it easier to crush.)
customer_reviews.author: MN MOM

customer_reviews.title: It smashes the cans.  Yaaaa
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2. One the handle came apart. So I stuck a bolt in it. I had laying around. It broke when I was using it no I wasn’t abusing it. And I was the first one, also , No problem with the other on at all they work great. There are about 5 of us that use it. It’s a lot easier if you gently squeeze can first. And I did grease both. One with real grease the other with Vaseline. I like them a lot. The kids love them.
customer_reviews.author: charles darr jr

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a month!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about the first 2 dozen cans and then the rivet in the handle gave way. It's not possible to fix it, we'll I suppose that you could wrap it with duct tape several times, but that itself will eventually become a sticky mess. Also, the arms that come down during the crushing have bent. I have definitely owned better and I'm actually looking to replace it, and it's been in use for less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have always used common sense and recycled aluminums and plastics. This allows me to easily crush all metal cans and in so doing compacts my recycling container probable 8 times over. It will crush plastic bottles as well which will recoil somewhat but still a big space savings.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart C

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and it is TOUGH
customer_reviews.text: We mounted this above our recycle tub and it works great. Just make sure you get it in a stud because it is going to generate a lot of pressure on the screws. Works great, crushes my Monster cans as well as those skinny Truly seltzer cans. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: misscelestia

customer_reviews.title: Bottom rubber grip tore and bottom metal bent down
customer_reviews.text: Now I didn't expect this to be able to withstand hundreds of pounds of pressure, but I would have thought at least it could crush two cans down. It bent after doing that the first time, not to mention the rubber grip tore as well. Not a great product. Or maybe I got a dud, but I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My kids love crushing cans and ours had been difficult to use so I invested in this. So glad I did!! Very easy to install (4 screws provided) and easy enough for my kids to pull down. We specifically chose this because it fits energy drink cans.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Light Gauge and Materials But Should Work Alright
customer_reviews.text: Lighter duty construction and material than a similar design that we have at the cabin. It's designed to not crush as flat as others but it seems this is one way to lessen the stress on the light gauge metal that it's made from. If you pinch the can when mounting it, it takes some stress off the machine and should add to its life. Without the prior exposure to a more substantial version, I imagine I wouldn't have the durability concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Craigclu

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have a trash can under it and as I crush the can, I drop it in. When the can is full, I close the bag and replace it with another. Ready to go again. Be sure to dent the can before sticking it in to crush. It is easier to pull the handle and it also will help your crusher last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Janlillie

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, bent out of shape after little use
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't leave reviews, but figured I should after this. The metal panels for the arms are far too thin, they bent out of shape and the device is next to useless. These were regular 12 oz. aluminum cans, and after about a dozen the metal warped and bent out of shape. I am able to bend them back into shape but it feels like all this could have been avoided if they hadn't cheaped out on the arm pieces. I would be happy to pay a bit extra for one that wouldn't fall apart, but given I was able to get only a handful of uses out of this, I don't think it's worth spending money on.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Decided to buy this after recycling bin blew over on a windy day and cans blew everywhere. Got this heavy duty model.. well worth the extra few bucks.. much sturdier than the standard ones.. and should hold up a long time with no issues. Squeeze can a little to start dents and crushes easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Bent on the first crush!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we recycle as much as possible. With this being able to crush bottles as well, I was super excited for this find. FIRST TIME USING: the aluminum bottle bent the crushing part. Now the handle won’t go up or down without wiggling it over the bent piece. Super disappointed in this purchase and now I will be on the search for another.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We've had this can crusher for a few months and so far it works great. The cans don't pop out while being crushed, and it seems sturdy enough so it should last. The hole for the plastic bottle crusher is kind of a waste, they pop right back into shape after you crush them, but we bought it for the cans so no big deal. We're very satisfied with the crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUNK JUNK JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This item was pretty beat up when it arrived -- paint chipped, foam pad crooked, etc. I considered returning it, but it seemed mechanically sound. I installed it and it works. UPDATE: After about 3 months the metal rod holding the hand-pad bent. I replaced it with a heavy lag bolt. Then the handle arm bent. i tried to get it back into shape, but once that thin crappy metal failed it would never hold shape again. Now unusable. JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Von Tilius

customer_reviews.title: Works but not sure for how long
customer_reviews.text: It will crush cans fairly well but I'm not sure how long its going to last. You need to be sure to pull straight down since any accidental twisting motion can cause it to start to warp. Its fun for kids to use but could stand to be made out of a little tougher material.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent idea with the added bottle crush feature...BUT!!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it does cans and plastic bottles. There is one issue that made me buy another stronger crusher made of steel. The armature that attaches the handle to the unit is thin, weak and easily bent by not putting torque exactly straight down making this a no no for kids to use. Once the arms bent, I straightened them and kept it for the bottles but bought a steel beast for cans.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Good for at least several years
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough. Takes the taller can which is good and crushes to a decent size. I think if the arms were a little beefier it would really last quite a long time. Keep it out of the rain and sun and it should last for several years.
customer_reviews.author: John Clinton

customer_reviews.title: This works fine
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher got some negative reviews from other people but for us it works great and it's fun smashing the cans. We hung it on the patio and the only thing that happened is it got a little hard to pull down but I put some lubricant on the track, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: California Girl

customer_reviews.title: Rickety and doesn’t seem like it will last much longer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but a little rickety. I don’t expect this to stand the test of time. The bottom is already a little crooked and moves when a can is crushed. I have crushed about 100 cans with this and it is wobbly and disappointing. It is not a smooth motion pulling the lever down to crush the can due to the whole contraption not being sturdy
customer_reviews.author: kdipirro

customer_reviews.title: Crushes like a beast
customer_reviews.text: Crushes cans like a beast. Works with reg cans, Monster energy size cans and most plastic bottles. Perrie bottles get stuck due to their shape. Was easy to install. So far holding up good. Already crushed hundreds of bottles and cans
customer_reviews.author: Digital_Hate

customer_reviews.title: No problems!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this every week since I purchased it and it works beautifully. It's mounted on a post outside, so it has withstood winter weather. It crushes the cans to less than an inch tall, and if you put two crushed cans in at the same time it gets them even smaller. I'm doing my part for the environment, and making a little money, too. If I wear this one out I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JollyMolly

customer_reviews.title: Crushing things is fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because the amount of cans that we have been going through has increased these past few months (from quarantine drinking). The build quality is great and I love that I can crush cans and plastic bottles. Having this allows me to store up more recyclables, which means less trips to the recycling center.
customer_reviews.author: alli.bot

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke after three days
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher broke on me after only three days. We didn't do anything crazy I mounted it over the trash can and it crushed cans from small soda cans to the tall skinny cans very well. It doesn't do so well with the small water bottles but that has nothing to do with the crusher just the fact that the water bottles don't crush well. After this broke I used three zip ties to make it work again but it was disappointing that it broke so quickly. My advice is to spend a little bit more money and get one that you don't have to fix and rig up to work.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Weak bottom and top plates
customer_reviews.text: The handle would fall on it's own but that issue resolved otself after the first dozen cans were crushed. After the top and bottom plates warped the handle is being held up by tension. Just to confirm, every can that was crushed was dented first.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: ... and squishy I covered mine with electrical tape and better, I'm sure a material
customer_reviews.text: you should change the handle as what you use gets wet and squishy I covered mine with electrical tape and better, I'm sure a material. Also might better for business if when discriibing this model as really not designed for the newly released 16 oz alum can's that have twist off caps and cone like tops. This model works fine with tab opening tops but when used on the newly released cans need a much more force. It works if you squeez the sides in before put crusher. I felt weakness when I did crush new cans SIDE TO SIDE WEAKNESS. I only wrote this because seemed you pride in what you sell. Respect R. B. Donnell
customer_reviews.author: robert b. donnell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Just recently started recycling since our trash services don’t offer it, we found a close recycling place. This has been pretty awesome so far. Crushes cans and plastic bottles with ease. 4 easy screws and it seems really durable. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Stuck in a Hole
customer_reviews.text: A bit too flimsy! Bent the unit on the first dozen cans. Still works but I'm going to have to modify it. Does not work well on small diameter came like Red Bull. Can goes through the hole and gets stuck. Modifying.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and not durable
customer_reviews.text: This does (just about) work, but not well. The cans are not fully crushed and the device is made of soft steel that easily bends and is not durable. This is really not something you want to buy, I cannot recommend it, stay away
customer_reviews.author: P. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: The Crush-inator 3000
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount, easy to use. Very satisfying crunch! Just started using this and have no issues at all. You do have to squeeze the can before crushing, but that's normal. My only suggestion would be to make sure you use anchors when mounting it to your wall for stability. It comes with screws, but no anchors. Thankfully, I had some of the correct size laying around. Will update in time after it has crushed more cans
customer_reviews.author: Michele Kahne

customer_reviews.title: Loving this
customer_reviews.text: I found cans were taking up too much room in my recycling bin so I ordered this. Very well constructed and easy to install. I am taking great pleasure in crushing my cans, Not sure why but I find it fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Can cruncher crunches cans for Canadians and everyone else
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It crunches stuff on the wall what's cooler than that! Cans, water bottles, even those burly Arizona green tea plastic bottles stand no chance against the crunchening! The guys in the apartment across the wall probabaly hate it but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy metal. Flaking Paint. Piece O Junk. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Made of the flimsiest metal imaginable, with paint that flaked off after one use. Piece of absolute junk. Doesn't even crush cans all the way down. Instead, it only crushes them about 5/8 of the way down. Why? Because any more force placed on the flimsy materials would break the thing completely. Do not buy. I will try another brand that hopefully uses better materials.
customer_reviews.author: Quickela

product_meta.title: McKay 12 oz. Metal Can Crusher, Heavy-Duty Wall-Mounted Smasher for Aluminum Seltzer, Soda, Beer Cans and Bottles for Recycling - Black
product_meta.description:
Size:12oz. Heavy Duty| Color:Black

Crush with Ease!
Make recycling fast and easy with the McKay 12 oz. Metal Can Crusher! Instantly crushes most cans to about 1 inch thick. Rubberized bottom lends an anti-slip surface for ease of use. Simply pull down the large, cushion-grip handle to crush cans into ultra-compact sizes for recycling. Indenting aluminum cans facilitates easier crushing.

Recycle While Having Fun!
The Can Crusher—made of heavy-gauge steel with a large, cushion-grip handle and built-in bottle opener—mounts vertically with 4 included wood screws, giving you maximum leverage for easier crushing. Compressing recyclables into approximately 1-inch pieces means taking more cans/bottles to the recycling center in fewer trips! Your recycling haul will be worth more money, and best of all, you'll be doing your part to help the environment.

HERE’S WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS MCKAY CAN CRUSHER:  * The easy-to-use, 12-oz. crusher smashes 12-oz. cans
 * Makes the recycling process more efficient. Save space in your recycling area by crushing cans easily and quickly
 * The all-steel construction is sturdy and built to last
 * Includes a built-in bottle opener for multifunctional convenience
 * Mounting locations include: garages, laundry rooms, pantries, basements, recycling areas, schools, and dorms


Item dimensions: 13.1 x 4.4 x 3.1 in.

Not recommended for free-standing operation; do not drill directly into dry wall.

McKay products are supported by exceptional customer support and a 1-year limited warranty.
Get this Can Crusher now to start recycling while having fun! Click ‘Add to Cart’ now!
feature_bullets: GREAT FOR THE ENVIRONMENT: Easily crushes cans/bottles to approx. 1-inch thick pieces for easy recycling—saving room in garbage/recycling bins

THE MCKAY CAN CRUSHER/SMASHER: Recycle seltzer, soda, pop, and beer cans; the 16-oz. crusher smashes standard 16 oz. AND 12 oz. aluminum cans and features a hole on its top plate to easily crush plastic bottles too!
SAFE AND RELIABLE: Mounts to any solid surface, wall, table, etc.; hardware included
STURDY ALL-STEEL CONSTRUCTION: features thick steel arms, reinforced upper plate, and a large, cushion-grip handle + a built-in bottle opener
ONLY 2 MOVING PARTS: an easy-to-grab handle (with bolt nuts for easy repair when necessary) is easy to operate—simply pull down the handle while steel plate crushes cans/bottles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,209 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
